title: Rethinking domain generalization in medical image segmentation: One image as one domain
details: J Hong, B Liu, G Long - arXiv preprint arXiv:2501.04741, 2025
abstract: Domain shifts in medical image segmentation, particularly when data comes from different centers, pose significant challenges. Intra-center variability, such as differences in scanner models or imaging protocols, can cause domain shifts as …

title: Multi-head attention debiasing and contrastive learning for mitigating Dataset Artifacts in Natural Language Inference
abstract: While Natural Language Inference (NLI) models have achieved high performances on benchmark datasets, there are still concerns whether they truly capture the intended task, or largely exploit dataset artifacts. Through detailed analysis of the …
